metadata.title: CVE-2023-20588 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
A division-by-zero error on some AMD processors can potentially returnspeculative data resulting in loss of confidentiality.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-20588` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-221-generic - 4.15.0-221.232
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-221-generic - 4.15.0-221.232
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-221-lowlatency - 4.15.0-221.232
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-163-generic - 5.4.0-163.180~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-163-lowlatency - 5.4.0-163.180~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1148-kvm - 4.15.0-1148.153
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-221.232').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4, was needs-triage').
